body.raw:
The primary protagonist of the historic movie "Medieval" Jan Zizka starred in English actor Ben Forster kept saying the three words "Death Brings Life" once his soldier or relative dies.

He would then take some seeds from a small pocket and plant them in the soil under the dead person's corpse.
As I watched the movie I kept thinking about what the real meaning of death brings to life.
Taking it literary, Jan was planting seeds under the corpse because as the body decomposes, nature will take its course where the grains will germinate and new life will come out under that body.
It will not be a total loss - as the death will facilitate new life with assumptions that I am not comparing human life with that of plants.
My thoughts are unbiased until this point but I don't know for how long I can hold on thinking on this particular perspective. Let's get biased.
Deviating from philosophical analysis, when one orders a burger or a nyama choma (roasted goat meat) meal, they are using dead cows or goat meat to get vital nutrients we need as humans for survival.
The animal's death did not happen in vain. It has facilitated human life by offering a meal out of its body.
What a sacrifice?! From this small analogy, death and life cannot be termed - always - as ying and yang, best and worst, or good and bad.
No, death and life are parallel. Each facilitates the other.
One has to happen for another to occur.
There can never be death where there was no life and in this way, there is no life without death.
The hardest part of agreeing with the parallelism of death and life is the ultimate sacrifice one has to make.
Who likes making sacrifices? I don't! Circumstances force us to make one.
It is human nature to find the easiest way to accomplish something.
Our brain is wired to find a shortcut in everything we do.
I would have loved a modern AI platform such as talk of the town right not ChatGPT to write this essay for me.
However, I knew it would not say what is in my mind no matter the precise input I will give to it.
I have made a sacrifice of staying in front of my laptop, type my raw thoughts as I am forced by a circumstance that no one will do it for me, the way I want it to be done.
The parallelism of my sacrifice in writing this essay will be the death of time I think I could have done something useful other writing to bring out my raw thoughts (debatable).
Death brings life. Our struggles to become productive, focused, or even useful needs the demise of bad habits in our lives. Kill the bad habits and give life to beneficial habits.

body.raw:
Blood is blood. Blood never lies. Does it?

Faced with difficult situations, a dilemma or an insurmountable act we always choose blood.
We all fall back there, no matter how we convince ourselves that we can make external allies, we always fall back there.
Blood murmurs.

It contains so many secrets that it cannot talk loudly since the world will burst.
When blood gives a secret, we exprience an apocalypse, annihilation or an extinction. Did one dinosaur betray the blood? Maybe.
Always - _la sangre es sangre_.

In the book _We were liars_ by **e. lockhart** it starts by stating that in Sinclair's family no one is a criminal, no one is a failure, no is an addict.
They believed they are all handsome, aggressive and their smiles are wide.
It may sound mirage based on our experiences but we are all liars.
They are blood. Their kind is bold. They may not mean it but they believe it.

We defend our kind not because we love them or we know they are innocent but rather because the coin flipped long time ago.
Nature does not control humans as it did. Since the first existence of humanity, humans survival depended on nature.
We are gradually controlling the nature, even our kind!

Today, natural environment is dependent of human abilities to control their kind - _fellow population_ - for nature's survival, else there will be disastrous occurences.
We have seen it. To my suprise, we all act suprised by prolonged drought, floods and ever-increasing desertification. We are on the negative side of the flipped coin. Brace yourself my kind.
We maybe the next dinosaur's kind. Facing extinction?. Yes!

There are some things which are difficult to fathom or explain to drive a point home
blood connection being one of them despite it influencing humans to have a fragile relationship with nature.

Do we need to flip the coin back on the positive side? Maybe.

Are we late? Maybe.

Can it be done? Maybe.

It can be done for the sake of our kind. It will be one of the difficult endavour we will engage as our kind but what choice do we have.

According to legends, a seer named Tenoch lead Mexica people to the valley of Mexico in search for a place to settle based on mythical belief that Mexica people should settle
in a place where they will find an eagle fighting a snake. As they maraund all over great lakes of Mexico searching their promised land, they were forced by native tribes occupying land unhabitated by waters to occupy an
island in the middle of the lake. Natives tribe wanted the nature to control Aztecs since the island was infested with poisonous snakes. Natives kind could not control the nature. Not quite.

To native tribes disappointment! Aztecs found their sign of eagle mauling snake with its beak on top of a cactus.
If that is not enough, where Aztecs came from snakes were considered a delicacy. Tenoch and people of his kind control the nature there occupying the area up to date (not sure).
Our kind may not be kind, one-call away or defend us they way we defend them, but they are blood.

## Le sangre es sangre

These words means now, as they meant in the previous sentences.

I believe in them!
